If the 1.0 RTW release is available only as part of the VS 2013 Update 2 RC, how can we install only the compiler to our build servers? Is there (or will be) a separate MSI available? Our sysadmins are not mastering node, so npm is not an option for us on the build servers.

Thanks,
  • György

You can use this on a build server to get just the TypeScript tools installed: http://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=34790 It's recommended that you still have the latest version of IE on those machines for the best performance.

Thanks, Dan, I'll try that.

The name of the package is a bit misleading, but now I see that the Install Instructions sections says, that "TypeScript for Visual Studio 2012 will install when Visual Studio 2012 is not installed, and provide the TypeScript compiler."
  • György
Agreed, it should definitely be clearer what it's for which would probably also make it more likely to turn up in search results for this scenario.
